page.title: 12Farming Part 4
page.content: Many of the fields will be carrying crops of grass and clover for hay, or silage or grazing. One of our farms grows nothing but fruit. During the {winter}raspberry canes are trimmed and tied to wires in long rows. In spring the leaves appear and are soon followed by flowers and during{July and{August}by masses of ripe red {raspberries.}Large numbers of people including children go to the{berries or{raspberry-picking.}As well as local people large numbers come from the towns by bus. The{berries}are picked into baskets or pails according to their quality. The ones in pails to be pulped for{jam}or{dye,}The ones in baskets are taken to a nearby{factory where they are{quick-frozen}and put into cold storage for table use across the{world. }
